title: Man City vs Atalanta LIVE: Stream, score and team news for Uefa Youth League fixture
text:
Manchester City host Serie A side Atalanta this evening hoping to extend their perfect record in this season’s Champions League.

Kyle Walker and Nicolas Otamendi have both returned to training, as City’s defensive injury crisis finally begins to ease. City beat Shakhtar Donetsk and Dinamo Zagreb in their opening two matches and will be looking to extend their lead at the top of Group C.

At 3pm, City’s Under-19 side will meanwhile take on their Atalanta counterparts in the Uefa Youth League, and we will bring you live coverage of that fixture before the Champions League game at 8pm.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

City vs Atalanta Uefa Youth League fixture kicks-off at 3pm

Uefa Champions League fixture kicks-off at 8pm

Follow live coverage of both matches with The Independent

There's a start for highly-rated 17-year-old Taylor Harwood-Bellis in defence for City today. The teenager impressed in the Carabao Cup win over Preston last month and is one to keep an eye on this afternoon. Here are today's other fixtures in the Uefa Youth League: Team News Manchester City's youth team, like the senior side, have made a strong start to their Champions League campaign. Paul Harsley’s have four points from their opening two games and will establish themselves at the top of Group C with victory over Atalanta this afternoon. Advertisement Good afternoon and welcome to our live coverage of Manchester City vs Atalanta. We will bring you live coverage of the Uefa Youth League match between the two sides, before the main course: the Champions League clash which kicks-off at 8pm.

Match preview:

When is it?

Kick-off is at 8pm BST on Monday 21st October.

How can I watch it?

The match will be broadcast on BT Sport 2, with coverage beginning at 7pm.

Subscribers to BT Sport can watch the game online or on mobile via the BT Sport player and BT Sport app.

Team news

Manchester City might welcome back John Stones to their lineup, with the fit again centre half set to reinforce a problem area. He could partner Nicolas Otamendi, who is over the issue that caused him to miss the Crystal Palace game.

Kyle Walker may be available, too, while Fernandinho could be rested after a busy couple of months as emergency cover in central defence. Phil Foden could feature as he presses for more game time.
